title: Stability of Carbon-Supported Nanoparticles in Hydrogen Fuel Cells Resolved by Automated Electron Tomography
content: Proton exchange membrane fuel cells (PEMFC) offer great promise for hydrogen powered heavy duty trucks requiring a higher density of energy, fast refueling and additional range. Nevertheless, durability remains a significant challenge, primarily stemming from catalyst degradation in the cathode. Addressing these performance losses necessitates a deeper comprehension of degradation mechanisms under accelerated stress tests (ASTs) through structural characterization and localization. Electron tomography emerges as a key tool for linking the degradation rate and mechanism of Pt-based nanoparticles relative to their location on or within the porous carbon support [1, 2].
